newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian Jan aluminium output rises to 244,500 T.
newsitem.headline: Russian Jan aluminium output rises to 244,500 T.

text.p: Russia produced 244,500 tonnes of primary aluminium in January, up 1.7 percent on year-ago levels, producers' group Kontsern Alyuminy said.

In figures carried by Interfax news agency, the group said that Ukraine produced 7,700 tonnes during the first month of this year, up 0.4 percent on year-ago levels, while Tajikistan had output of 15,800 tonnes, down 13.7 percent year-on-year.
January output at Russia's Bratsk smelter, the world's largest, was about 68,000 tonnes, 5.8 percent higher than in the same month in 1996.
Krasnoyarsk produced around 66,000 tonnes, a 0.2 percent fall year-on-year.
The Sayansk smelter, Russia's third biggest, produced 28,000 tonnes, up 1.1 percent, while Irkutsk produced 21,600 tonnes, up 2.9 percent.
January alumina production in the Commonwealth of Independent States fell 2.7 percent year-on-year to 372,300 tonnes.
Of that total, Russia produced 183,000 tonnes, or 5.9 percent less than it did in January 1996.
Ukraine's Nikolayev alumina refinery produced 81,000 tonnes, unchanged from January last year, while the Zaporozhye refinery produced 16,300 tonnes, down 6.9 percent.
The Pavlodar alumina plant in Kazakhstan produced 92,000 tonnes of alumina in January, 2.8 percent higher than year-ago volumes.
